mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Quincy, Abraham Howard, 1767-1840
mdRecord.dcterms:description: His new system [stove] in satisfactory operation at City Hall; almost whole literary world against his idea of compressing fluid fire by multiplied passages in stoves; Mr. Dasheaff, the Russian minister, saw it; Mr. Fulton's examination inadequate and opinion prejudiced; General Dearborn inspected it for ship and camp cooking; sufficient clay near Oxford to produce them.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Fulton, Robert, 1765-1815
Dearborn, Henry, 1751-1829
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1814 May 10, New York, [New York] to Thomas Jefferson, n.p.
